title: importing aol folders to thunderbird
content: Got new Win 11 computer. migrated all AOL to it. Had to reset my computer due to something i messed up. Now I got TB back on to receive and send emails but cant get my folders to TB. Have uninstalled several times, correct settings (verizon-aol email), have read many posts and articles and nothing works. I really want to import but aol is not listed in the import section. when I try to reconfigure it says "Incoming server already exists." TY
creator: chelma1

title: Strange - some folders open expanded but others do not and different each session!
content:
I am running Supernova version 115.5.2 and have a strange situation (maybe it's normal) when opening it.

If I have received any emails for any account in a previous session, then when I open a new session, the folders for these accounts open expanded and other accounts that did not receive any emails, remain collapsed.

I know there are others who have various issues regarding all folders expanded or collapsed but in Thunderbird before Supernova, I always collapsed all my folders and opened a new session with everything collapsed.

So can anyone tell me how to set-up Supernova so that when I collapse all my folders at the end of a session, a new session will open with all the folders still collapsed?

Thanks.
creator: Hawkeye58

title: I have Thunderbird installed on two computers and I cannot get TB to send emails.
content: I have Thunderbird installed on two computers and I cannot get TB to send emails. I can receive email but cannot send. My provider is Spectrum and I have gone to their website and filled in TB with Spectrums info but I still can't send. Do you have step by step instructions on properly filling in my information into TB? Thank you. Sam
creator: sam160

title: Deleted Messages showing up as read (old was Bug 1856993)
content:
The problem I had earlier with Thunderbird 115.5.2 and Charter/Spectrum iMap has gotten worse, it now happens time I log into the open folder regardless of the account or folder. If I compact, it just lessens the number of deleted or moved messages that reappear on its initial read of the inbox from the server. The messages that show up are marked as read and if I got to another account and then back, they disappear. If I stay within the same account, they stay regardless of the folder I go to, until I go to another account and back.

Compacting just minimizes what it sees, it does NOT cure the problem.
creator: gwestlun

title: Merge identical named folder contents
content:
I have many folders imported from an old Thunderbird installation into my current one.

All messages from that installation are in the 'Archives' folders but are the same names as my current installation: 

    Local Folders\Online Shopping\Ashampoo     Archives\2008\Online Shopping\Ashampoo

When I move Ashampoo folder in Archives to Local Folders, i'd like to be able to merge the contents automatically instead of Thunderbird offering to create a second folder with a number appended.

I have a lot of folders to process and my wrists are hurting already.
creator: Bangfeast

title: Trash folder
content:
How can I set my Trash folder to require manual emptying? (Windows 10, TB 115.5.2, 64-bit)

I like to keep the contents of my Trash folder until the end of the day, as I might need to refer to emails that I have put there earlier. I also enjoy the emptying the thing manually before I close the program at the end of the day, as it gives me the satisfaction of doing some cleaning without actually having to scrub a floor.

Unfortunately, the folder sometimes (not always) empties itself if we have a power failure, and it empties if I accidentally close the program, which is easier now with the new design, which I find a little hard to read.

I'd like to be able to set the Trash folder to keep its contents until I deliberately, with malice aforethought, set out to cause it to become empty through a decisive action on my part.

I have searched Thunderbird support, but I've not found a relevant article. Although I've used keywords from mt question above and tailored my search to the extent possible for TB 115, Windows 10, I've found only results that aren't relevant enough to be useful.
creator: AlphaCat

title: Errore invio email
content:
Buongiorno, sono a richiedere se possibile, un Vs. supporto per il seguente problema: sono alcuni giorni, che non riesco ad inviare email con Thunderbird (vers. 115.5.2 64 bit). Come server posta in uscita ho sempre usato Aruba. L'errore che viene ritornato è "non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perchè la connessione col server smtps.aruba.it è scaduta", a volte invece oltre al questo messaggio indica anche che la connessione potrebbe essere stata rifiutata. Random, con estrema lentezza qualche email viene inviata. Ho provato a impostare come server posta uscita gmail, ma anche con questo ho lo stesso risultato. Ho provato a cancellare l'account e ricrearlo, ma senza esito. In ultimo ho scaricato e reinstallato thunderbird ma senza esito. Tramite webmail aruba le email vengono inviate. Stessa configurazione su PC dei colleghi, funziona tutto. Non so cosa controllare per risolvere il problema. Ringrazio per l'aiuto. Cordiali saluti

Daniele Griotti
creator: danielegriotti
